author: pcaversaccio
content: if someone from the co-authors of EIP-2935 could dm please, would be highly appreciated. I tried to ping already but without any success so far. I have a question regarding the deployment section specifically.

author: sky.cactus
content: Does anyone have data on how much disk space every 32 bytes of data stored on Ethereum (in a contract storage slot) costs, inclusive of all supporting data structures like the MPT stuff?  I'm curious about both best case and worst case scenario, where I assume best case is that all data is stored in a single contract and worst case is that every 32 bytes of data is stored in a different contract.

author: lightclient
content: by cost do you mean the total size?

author: sky.cactus
content: Yeah, like how many bytes of disk space (state specifically, not history) is consumed by an SSTORE essentially.

author: sky.cactus
content: I know at the least there is some overhead in the MPT, but I'm not sure how much that is and I'm guessing it is a function of average tree depth.  But there may be other things that contribute to the real disk cost of each SSTORE beyond that and the data itself.
